critiques.subject: Sunset with swirling clouds and tree silhouettes
improvements: [MODERATE] Increase local contrast (Clarity) on the cloud formations
preserve: The silhouette nature of the foreground trees
The natural gradient transition from orange to blue
critiques.notes: A strong composition balancing the sun on the left with the vertical trees on the right. The unique cloud pattern is the hero of this shot and should be highlighted through texture adjustments, while keeping the color grading natural but vibrant.

improvements_detailed.action: Increase local contrast (Clarity) on the cloud formations
improvements_detailed.reason: To emphasize the unique swirling texture of the lenticular-style clouds without making the whole image gritty
To ensure the tree silhouettes are solid black against the colorful sky, removing any muddy shadow details
To enhance the golden hour orange tones while preventing the blue upper sky from looking gray
To soften the transition around the sun disk and recover slight detail in the brightest orange areas

context.subject: Sunset with swirling clouds and tree silhouettes
preserve: The silhouette nature of the foreground trees
The natural gradient transition from orange to blue

critiques.subject: Sunset over a distant body of water with silhouetted trees in the foreground
improvements: [MODERATE] Recover highlight detail around the sun by lowering Highlights (~-40 to -70) and Whites slightly (~-10 to -25), then use a subtle radial mask to tame the brightest core while keeping it luminous
[SUBTLE] Lift midtone shadows selectively in the tree line/foreground with a luminance-range mask (Shadows +15 to +30) while keeping true blacks anchored (Blacks -5 to -15)
[SUBTLE] Add local contrast and structure to the cloud bands using a graduated mask (Texture +10 to +20, Clarity +8 to +15, Dehaze +5 to +10)
[MODERATE] Crop slightly from the left edge (and a touch from the bottom if needed) to remove the small dark intrusion and tighten composition around the sun and tall trees
[SUBTLE] Apply mild output sharpening with masking (e.g., Amount 40–60, Radius 0.8–1.2, Masking 70–90) and slight noise reduction in the sky (Luminance NR 10–20)
preserve: The warm sunset color palette and gradient
The strong silhouetted tree shapes as a compositional anchor
critiques.notes: The image has a pleasing sunset gradient and strong silhouette composition, with attractive layered clouds. Minor highlight recovery, selective shadow control, and localized sky contrast will improve tonal balance and clarity while preserving the intended warm, tranquil mood.

improvements_detailed.action: Recover highlight detail around the sun by lowering Highlights (~-40 to -70) and Whites slightly (~-10 to -25), then use a subtle radial mask to tame the brightest core while keeping it luminous
improvements_detailed.reason: Reduces the blown/very bright area and improves tonal gradation near the sun without losing the sunset impact.

improvements_detailed.action: Lift midtone shadows selectively in the tree line/foreground with a luminance-range mask (Shadows +15 to +30) while keeping true blacks anchored (Blacks -5 to -15)
improvements_detailed.reason: Reveals a touch more separation and detail in the silhouettes so the foreground reads cleaner without breaking the dusk mood.

improvements_detailed.action: Add local contrast and structure to the cloud bands using a graduated mask (Texture +10 to +20, Clarity +8 to +15, Dehaze +5 to +10)
improvements_detailed.reason: Enhances the layered cloud pattern and depth in the sky, guiding the eye across the frame.

improvements_detailed.action: Crop slightly from the left edge (and a touch from the bottom if needed) to remove the small dark intrusion and tighten composition around the sun and tall trees
improvements_detailed.reason: Eliminates a distracting element and strengthens the visual balance between the sun and the dominant tree silhouettes.

improvements_detailed.action: Apply mild output sharpening with masking (e.g., Amount 40–60, Radius 0.8–1.2, Masking 70–90) and slight noise reduction in the sky (Luminance NR 10–20)
improvements_detailed.reason: Keeps edges of the trees crisp while preventing the smooth sky from looking gritty after contrast adjustments.
